# Crypto 2019

## Descripcion

Oracles can be your best friend, they will decrypt anything, except the flag's ciphertext. How will you break it? Connect with `nc mercury.picoctf.net 30048`.

## Pistas (Si hay)

What can you do with a different pair of ciphertext and plaintext? What if it is not so different after all...

## Solución

``` Bash

┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ python3 
Python 3.10.5 (main, Jun  8 2022, 09:26:22) [GCC 11.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> n = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> n = 
>>> c = 
>>> x = pow(2,e,n)
>>> c * x

>>> m = 580550060391700078946913236734911770139931497702556153513487440893406629034802718534645538074938502890769425795379846471930
>>> m // 2
290275030195850039473456618367455885069965748851278076756743720446703314517401359267322769037469251445384712897689923235965
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'\xe0\xd2\xc6\xde\x86\xa8\x8c\xf6\xdah\xf2\xc4f\xbe\xa8\xd0`\xe6\xca\xbe\xdaf\xe6jh\xcef\xe6\xbeh\xe4f\xbe\xc8\xd2\xcc\xea\xe4\xe4\xca\xdc\xe8\xbej`jdld`\xfa'
>>> long_to_bytes(290275030195850039473456618367455885069965748851278076756743720446703314517401359267322769037469251445384712897689923235965)
b'picoCTF{m4yb3_Th0se_m3s54g3s_4r3_difurrent_5052620}'


```
